description.narrative:
During the negotiations, Unicef ##actively contributed to negotiations and proposals for texts, in particular due to due diligence and addressing systemic risks. UNICEF also participated in three working groups that were established. UNICEF has also played a veryactive role in coordinating the various NGOs. The cooperation of the round table was intensive and has had many rounds. In fact, wewere not ready in September and it looks like the covenant will only be ready for signing at the start of Q2 2019.
From September 2018, UNICEF has worked hard to fulfill its ambitions, roadmap and determine the KPIs (key performance indicators ).
during Q1 2019we are mainly concerned with the budget that fits the set of ambition, the stakeholders and support consultations.
During the 6 months UNICEF spends 0.2 FTE on the covenant in the form of consultations, consultations, gathering information and sharing information.
Civil society organizations are represented by CNV and FNV (in part), IUCN and UNICEF Netherlands; Global March against Child Labor is also partially sitting at the table.

participating-org.narrative: The "Nederlands Comité Unicef" is a childrens’ rights organisation and is one of the UNICEF country committees in 34 (industrialized) countries; each of them is established as an independent local non-governmental organization. The UN has asked UNICEF to ensure that countries meet the UN treaty for the rights of children. The national committees raise funds from the private sector. UNICEF's programmes emphasize developing community-level services to promote the health and well-being of children. Together with others UNICEF wants to give every child the chance to be child. Every child needs to grow up healthy, has a right to develop and get the most out of life. It does not matter where they live, what they believe and what their origin is.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
